description: Change of use of front room of house as telephone booking office for taxi / chauffering business
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of five years from the date of this permission.  REASON:	In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990. | The front room of the premises, as depicted on the drawings stamped as 'Received 26 Sep 2002', shall be used as a telephone booking office and the remainder of the site shall not be used for any other purpose associated with the operation of taxis or chauffering, including any other use within Class B1 of the Schedule to the Town and Country Planning (Use Classes) Order 1987 without the prior written permission of the Local Planning Authority obtained through the submission of a planning application.  REASON:	To restrict the use of the premises to one compatible with the surrounding area, and to enable the Local Planning Authority to maintain strict control over the nature of the use, in the interests of the living conditions of occupiers in the locality, in accordance with Adopted Unitary Development Plan (UDP) Policies E9, E11, Replacement UDP Policy 6.1. | Notwithstanding the Town and Coutry Planning (Control of Advertisements) Regulations 1992, no advertisements are to be displayed on the site in association with the permitted use without the prior written permission of the Local Planning Authority obtained through the submission of a planning application.  REASON: To ensure the use of the premises is not detrimental to the visual character and appearance of the area, in accordance with Adopted Unitary Development Plan (UDP) Policy E11, Replacement UDP Policy 6.1.
